CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial
JUDGES: David Thór Björgvinsson;Giovanni Bonello;Lech Garlicki;Ledi Bianku;Mihai Poalelungi;Nicolas Bratza
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in Otwock .
CARDINAL . The applicant lives in a block of flats in NORP .

CARDINAL . In DATE ( according to the applicant ) or in DATE ( according to the applicant ’s neighbour ) the applicant ’s neighbour fitted bars to his balcony in such a way that they could serve as a ladder to the applicant ’s apartment on the first floor , and subsequently , in DATE , he adapted part of the staircase as a cellar by constructing a wall , allegedly without the required permit .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant informed the competent administrative authority about the construction works and requested that his neighbour be ordered to dismantle the bars and the wall on the staircase .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following numerous letters from the applicant seeking to accelerate the proceedings , ORG ( ORG ) ordered the applicant ’s neighbour to carry out some reconstruction works on the bars . It did not refer to the wall on the staircase .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant appealed to the GPE Governor ( Wojewoda ) .
CARDINAL . The GPE Governor did not give a decision within the statutory DATE time - limit . Therefore , on DATE , the applicant complained to ORG ( PERSON ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the Chief Building Inspector allowed the complaint and ordered the Governor to give a decision within DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE Governor upheld the first - instance decision . The Governor did not refer to the wall .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG ( Najwyższy Sąd Administracyjny ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the challenged decision and the decision of the first - instance authority .
CARDINAL . Apparently ORG scheduled another hearing to deal with a second part of the applicant ’s complaint , concerning the wall constructed on his staircase .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave another judgment and ordered ORG to give a decision in the matter of the wall constructed by the applicant ’s neighbour , within DATE of the date of delivery of the judgment .
CARDINAL . From DATE on which ORG gave its second judgment , the administrative proceedings were split into CARDINAL separate sets of proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered that expert opinions concerning fire regulations be obtained and imposed on the applicant ’s neighbour an obligation to produce , within DATE , a new specification for the installation of the bars on his balcony .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s neighbour failed to comply with the abovementioned order and , on DATE , ORG sent him a reminder , set an additional DATE time - limit to carry out the necessary works and informed him that failure to comply with the order within the new time - limit would result in compulsory demolition of the bars .
CARDINAL . The applicant ’s neighbour again did not comply with the order .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered compulsory demolition of the bars .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed against that decision holding that the demolition order should have concerned not only the bars , but also the canopy over the applicant ’s neighbour ’s balcony .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant complained to ORG of inactivity on the part of the administration .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant again lodged with ORG a complaint of inactivity on the part of the administrative authorities .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG acknowledged that “ unreasonable delay ” had occurred DATE ( the date on which the applicant had lodged his appeal against the first - instance decision ) and DATE ( the date on which the appellate administrative authority gave its decision , see below ) . However , the court , finding that the decision following the applicant ’s appeal had just been given by ORG , discontinued the proceedings and refused to impose a fine on the authority for delay .

CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP Regional Inspector of Construction Supervision quashed ORG decision of DATE and discontinued the proceedings , finding that the challenged decision had been founded on a wrong legal basis .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant appealed .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the challenged decision , which meant that the decision ordering demolition of the bars remained in force .
CARDINAL . On DATE the NORP Regional Inspector of Construction Supervision upheld the decision of DATE , which had ordered the compulsory demolition of the bars .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged with the Chief Inspector of Construction Supervision ( PERSON ) , a complaint of inactivity on the part of ORG , who had failed to enforce the final judgment of ORG .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the applicant ’s neighbour appealed against the decision of DATE to ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the applicant ’s neighbour to rectify some procedural shortcomings of his appeal . He failed to do so within the prescribed time - limit and consequently on DATE , ORG dismissed his appeal .

CARDINAL . On DATE the Chief Inspector of Construction Supervision found the applicant ’s complaint of inactivity ill - founded and informed the applicant that the competent authority to enforce the final judgment and order demolition of the bars was the ORG of Construction Supervision ( Powiatowy Inspektor Nadzoru Budowlanego ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the GPE Governor upheld the challenged decision .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged a complaint with ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered ORG ) , who had meanwhile become the authority with jurisdiction to deal with that case , to send it the file concerning the challenged decision .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant ’s complaint against the GPE Governor ’s decision of DATE .
